definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: Pack the clothes carefully so that you don't crease them.
sentences.chinese: 把衣服细心装好，免得弄皱了。

sentences.english: You mustn't play in your new skirt, you'll rumple it.
sentences.chinese: 你千万不要穿着新裙子去玩耍，你会把它弄皱的。
他把他的新西装弄皱了。

sentences.english: Don't sit for too long or you'll crease your new dress.
sentences.chinese: 不要坐地太久，否则你的新衣服会弄皱的。

sentences.english: Crumple a few sheets into balls and place them in with piles of kindling.
sentences.chinese: 将报纸弄皱攒成球状，把它们和劈柴放在一起。

sentences.english: Ikey threw his week's wages in a crumpled roll upon the bar.
sentences.chinese: 艾奇把他那卷弄皱的一星斯的工资扔到吧台上。

sentences.english: Be careful not to crease up my book.
sentences.chinese: 小心别把我的书弄皱了。

sentences.english: The Beetle took shelter on wet a linen wrinkled from the heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 甲虫爬到一块被大雨打湿弄皱的亚麻布上避雨。

sentences.english: It was Jane who crumpled up the document.
Mary rumpled her dress by sitting on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽坐在地板上，因而把衣服弄皱了。

definition: to mess up/to put into disorder/to meddle with/to confuse
(of sth sharp) to snag (one's stockings etc)
to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
to tear up/to tear to pieces
corner of the lower hem of a jacket etc
